name: Maggie Pie
text: I spent my first Easter Sunday away from home in 1979 at St Nicholas. I have long since moved...  After 50 years I hope to see another Service this year...  yours in Christ timothy

name: Brian W. Kittrell
text: Wonderful church community. Came up here for the Russian Food Festival. Had the opportunity to first-hand witness the hospitality and dedication of the parish and their outreach along with the festival. Certainly worth the drive — especially if you are within a couple hours drive — to see the work they do. The church itself and its history are very interesting.

name: Gilbert R. Stone
text:
What a Gem ! This Russian Orthodox Church is a great piece of Alabama history & part of our mining history!
It is in the little town of Brookside ,Alabama.

name: Barbara Dollar
text: It was beautiful and the food was delicious! Thankful to have this gem in our community!

name: Chef Dana Barnes
text:
Beautiful church with many years of community ties to Birmingham and Brookside.
Wonderful experience at annual food festival for 2019.

name: Frank Pierson
text: Long line to wait 2&1/2 hours for food.....but worth Every Second...

name: Bargainomics Lady
text: Attended their food festival. Wonderful foid and really enjoyed touring the church.

name: George William
text: We came here for the food festival and found our new church. Fantastic congregation. A real gem in an unlikely location.
